wf_workflow_version.description: The Purpose of this work flow is to demonstrate how a Workflow can still access other Tables eventhough is must be 'bound' to one specific table by the Workflow Creation Wizard. The JavaScript can make use of a GlideRecord(<tablename>) to build a query and then iterate over records from that Table(s). However, note that GlideRecord sucks at Error/Exception Handling. There are posts on the Community Forum that show people creating their own GlideRecord constrction Wrapper that includes error handling scenarios.
wf_workflow_version.name: ZombieWorld_2Flows_ManyTables
wf_workflow_version.on_cancel: // This script executes if the workflow is cancelled.// The global variable context_sys_id contains the sys_id of the cancelled workflow context.

wf_workflow.description: The Purpose of this work flow is to demonstrate how a Workflow can still access other Tables eventhough is must be 'bound' to one specific table by the Workflow Creation Wizard. The JavaScript can make use of a GlideRecord(<tablename>) to build a query and then iterate over records from that Table(s). However, note that GlideRecord sucks at Error/Exception Handling. There are posts on the Community Forum that show people creating their own GlideRecord constrction Wrapper that includes error handling scenarios.
wf_workflow.name: ZombieWorld_2Flows_ManyTables

wf_activity.name: Alert that the Player FAILED to be made ready.

gs.addErrorMessage("wfZW_apfmr.1-- PLAYER FAILED to be Ready !!");

activity.display_value: Alert that the Player FAILED to be made ready.

wf_activity.name: Alert that the PLAYER has been made READY

sys_variable_value.value: gs.addInfoMessage('wfZW_apmr.1-- ScratchPad Variable is set to FALSE.');
